name: Upper Body Hypertrophy Breakthrough
description: An 8-week progressive overload program designed to break through your bench press plateau and build significant upper body muscle mass. Combines strength protocols with hypertrophy techniques using strategic supersets for time efficiency while respecting your shoulder limitation.

phases.name: Foundation & Volume Accumulation
phases.focus: Building work capacity and addressing weak points through strategic volume
phases.explanation: This phase establishes a solid foundation by increasing training volume progressively while identifying and strengthening weak links in your pressing chain. We'll use moderate weights with higher rep ranges to build muscle tissue and improve work capacity, setting the stage for heavier lifting in phase 2.
phases.expectations: Expect muscle soreness in weeks 1-2 as your body adapts to increased volume. Your bench press may not increase immediately, but you'll notice improved muscle fullness and endurance. Energy levels should stabilize by week 3.
keyPoints: Focus on mind-muscle connection and perfect form
Strategic superset pairings for efficiency and recovery
Building pressing endurance and weak point identification

workouts.name: Upper Body Push A
workouts.focus: Horizontal pressing emphasis with chest and tricep development

activities: 5 minutes light rowing or arm circles
Empty bar bench press 2x10 with pause
Doorway chest stretch 30 seconds each side
Overhead tricep stretch 30 seconds each arm

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Plateau buster focus - pause 1 second at chest each rep
instructions: Retract shoulder blades and arch upper back slightly, feet flat on floor
Lower bar to lower chest with elbows at 45-degree angle, not flared
Drive through feet and press bar in slight arc back toward face

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.notes: 30-degree incline, focus on upper chest stretch
instructions: Set bench to 30-degree angle, dumbbells at shoulder level
Lower with control feeling deep stretch in upper chest
Press up and slightly together without clanking dumbbells

exercises.name: Dumbbell Flyes
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise
instructions: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout movement
Lower until deep stretch is felt, arms roughly parallel to floor
Squeeze chest at top without letting dumbbells touch

exercises.name: Tricep Rope Pushdowns
exercises.notes: Superset with flyes above
instructions: Keep elbows pinned to sides throughout movement
Spread rope apart at bottom and squeeze triceps hard
Control the negative for 2 seconds on each rep

exercises.name: Overhead Dumbbell Tricep Extension
exercises.notes: Focus on long head stretch
instructions: Hold single dumbbell overhead with both hands cupping the top plate
Lower behind head keeping upper arms stationary and close to ears
Extend fully and squeeze triceps at top

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
exercises.notes: Light weight, high quality reps for shoulder health
instructions: Lead with pinkies slightly higher than thumbs
Raise to shoulder height only, no higher
Control descent for 2 seconds, no swinging

workouts.name: Lower Body A
workouts.focus: Quad-dominant with glute and hamstring accessory work

activities: Leg swings front and back 10 each leg
Hip flexor stretch 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
exercises.notes: High bar position, focus on depth and control
instructions: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder width, toes slightly out
Break at hips and knees simultaneously, keep chest up
Descend until hip crease below knee, drive through full foot

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Focus on hamstring stretch at bottom
instructions: Start standing with bar at hips, slight knee bend maintained throughout
Push hips back while lowering bar along thighs
Stop when you feel strong hamstring stretch, squeeze glutes to return

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.notes: 12 reps per leg, controlled steps
instructions: Take long stride forward, front shin vertical at bottom
Back knee hovers just above ground
Drive through front heel to step forward into next rep

exercises.name: Leg Curl Machine
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise
instructions: Adjust pad to sit just above ankles
Curl with control, squeeze hamstrings at top for 1 second
Lower slowly for 3-count negative

exercises.name: Leg Extension Machine
exercises.notes: Superset with leg curls above
instructions: Adjust backrest so knees align with machine pivot point
Extend fully and squeeze quads hard at top for 2 seconds
Lower with control, dont let weight stack crash

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Full stretch at bottom, pause at top
instructions: Position balls of feet on platform, heels hanging off
Lower heels until maximum stretch is felt
Rise onto toes as high as possible, pause 2 seconds at top

workouts.name: Upper Body Pull A
workouts.focus: Back thickness and width with bicep development

activities: Lat stretch on rack 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Barbell Bent Over Row
exercises.notes: Builds pressing antagonist strength for bench improvement
instructions: Hinge at hips until torso is 45 degrees, flat back
Pull bar to lower chest, squeezing shoulder blades together
Lower with control, maintaining hip hinge position throughout

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-Ups
exercises.notes: Add weight as needed, or use assistance if necessary
instructions: Grip slightly wider than shoulder width, palms facing away
Initiate pull by depressing shoulder blades, then bend elbows
Pull until chin clears bar, lower with full control

exercises.name: Chest Supported Dumbbell Row
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise - great for removing momentum
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench set to 30-45 degrees
Let arms hang straight down, pull dumbbells to hips
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top, lower slowly

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Superset with rows - critical for shoulder health
instructions: Set cable at face height, grip rope with palms down
Pull rope to face while externally rotating shoulders
End position has thumbs pointing behind you, squeeze rear delts

exercises.name: Barbell Curl
exercises.notes: Strict form, no swinging
instructions: Stand with feet hip width, elbows pinned to sides
Curl bar in arc toward shoulders, keeping upper arms stationary
Lower with control for 2-3 seconds, full extension at bottom

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
exercises.notes: Great long head stretch for bicep development
instructions: Set bench to 45-60 degrees, let arms hang straight down
Curl dumbbells while keeping upper arms perpendicular to floor
Squeeze biceps at top, lower slowly feeling the stretch

workouts.name: Lower Body B
workouts.focus: Hip hinge dominant with quad and calf accessory

activities: Standing hamstring stretch 30 seconds each leg

exercises.name: Conventional Deadlift
exercises.notes: Lower reps for quality, builds full body strength
instructions: Feet hip width, bar over mid-foot, grip just outside knees
Push floor away while keeping chest up and bar close to body
Lock out by squeezing glutes, dont hyperextend lower back

exercises.name: Front Squat
exercises.notes: Excellent quad builder and core stability
instructions: Bar rests on front delts, elbows high creating shelf
Descend straight down, keeping torso more upright than back squat
Drive up through full foot, elbows stay high throughout

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.notes: Feet shoulder width, focus on full range of motion
instructions: Place feet shoulder width in middle of platform
Lower weight until knees approach 90 degrees, no butt lift
Press through full foot, dont lock knees completely at top

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.notes: 10 reps each leg, balance and unilateral strength
instructions: Rear foot laces down on bench, front foot 2 feet ahead
Lower straight down until back knee nearly touches ground
Drive through front heel, keep torso upright

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raise
exercises.notes: Targets soleus muscle for complete calf development
instructions: Sit with knees bent 90 degrees, balls of feet on platform
Lower heels as far as flexibility allows
Raise heels as high as possible, hold contraction 2 seconds

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raises
exercises.notes: Core work to support all compound lifts
instructions: Hang from bar with slight bend in elbows to engage lats
Raise legs with control, curling pelvis up at end
Lower slowly, dont swing or use momentum

workouts.name: Upper Body Push B
workouts.focus: Bench press variation day with shoulder and tricep emphasis

activities: 5 minutes arm circles and band work
Rotator cuff warm-up with light band
Pec minor stretch on wall 30 seconds each side
Tricep and lat stretch 30 seconds each

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.notes: Builds tricep strength for lockout power on bench
instructions: Grip shoulder width or slightly narrower, same setup as bench
Keep elbows closer to body, around 30-degree angle
Lower to lower chest, press back in slight arc

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: No behind neck movements per your limitation
instructions: Sit with back firmly against pad, dumbbells at shoulder height
Press straight up, bringing dumbbells together at top
Lower with control to starting position, elbows at 45 degrees

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.notes: Slight forward lean for chest emphasis, add weight if needed
instructions: Grip bars and lean torso forward about 15-20 degrees
Lower until upper arms parallel to ground, no deeper
Press up powerfully, squeezing chest and triceps at top

exercises.name: Cable Crossover
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise
instructions: Set cables at shoulder height or slightly above
Step forward, maintain slight elbow bend throughout
Bring hands together in front of chest, squeeze pecs hard

exercises.name: Diamond Push-Ups
exercises.notes: Superset with cable crossovers
instructions: Hands together forming diamond shape under chest
Lower chest to hands keeping elbows close to body
Press up squeezing triceps, maintain rigid plank position

exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raises
exercises.notes: Better tension curve than dumbbells for shoulder development
instructions: Stand sideways to low cable, grab handle with far hand
Raise arm to shoulder height with slight elbow bend
Lower with control, maintain constant tension

exercises.name: Overhead Rope Tricep Extension
exercises.notes: Finisher for tricep long head development
instructions: Face away from low cable, hold rope overhead
Lower rope behind head keeping upper arms stationary
Extend fully overhead, spread rope apart at top

mealTiming: Breakfast: High protein within 1 hour of waking
Pre-workout: Carbs and protein 1.5-2 hours before training
Post-workout: Protein shake within 30 minutes, full meal within 2 hours
Pre-bed: Casein protein or cottage cheese for overnight recovery
nutrition.notes: Slight caloric surplus to support muscle growth. At 185 lbs, aim for 1g protein per pound bodyweight. Prioritize carbs around training for energy and recovery. Keep fats moderate and mostly from whole food sources.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn the program, establish baseline weights at RPE 7
Week 2: Increase weight 5 lbs on compounds if form is solid, same weight on isolation
Week 3: Add 1 rep to each set where possible before adding weight
Week 4: Test new working weights, aim for 5-10 lb increases on main lifts

phases.name: Strength & Intensity Amplification
phases.focus: Lower rep strength work with intensity techniques to break plateaus
phases.explanation: Building on the volume base from phase 1, we now shift to heavier loading with lower rep ranges. This phase uses proven plateau-breaking techniques including pause reps, tempo manipulation, and strategic back-off sets. The goal is to translate the muscle built in phase 1 into maximal strength output.
phases.expectations: Expect to feel stronger by week 2. The lower volume but higher intensity will feel different - less pump, more neural fatigue. Your bench press should start moving again. Some workouts will feel heavy; trust the process.
keyPoints: Heavier weights with lower rep ranges
Pause reps and tempo work for plateau busting
Maintained volume on accessory work for muscle retention
Strategic deload in final week before testing

workouts.name: Upper Body Push A - Heavy
workouts.focus: Maximum strength development on horizontal pressing

activities: Gradual warm-up sets: 50% x 5, 70% x 3, 85% x 1

exercises.name: Paused Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: 2-second pause at chest - this breaks plateaus
instructions: Set up exactly like normal bench with tight arch and retracted scapula
Lower to chest and hold completely motionless for 2 full seconds
Explode off chest driving through legs, no bouncing

exercises.name: Spoto Press
exercises.notes: Stop 1 inch above chest, builds bottom-end strength
instructions: Lower bar to 1 inch above chest and pause there for 1 second
Do not let bar touch chest, maintain tension in pecs
Press back up with control, focusing on chest activation

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Press
exercises.notes: 30-degree incline for upper chest strength
instructions: Set incline to 30 degrees, same grip as flat bench or slightly narrower
Touch bar to upper chest just below clavicle
Press in slight arc back toward face, lockout over shoulders

exercises.name: Weighted Dips
exercises.notes: Add weight as tolerated, builds pressing strength
instructions: Add weight with belt, grip bars and lean forward slightly
Lower until upper arms parallel or just below
Press up powerfully, dont lock elbows aggressively at top

exercises.name: Close Grip Cable Pushdown
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise - lockout strength builder
instructions: Grip V-bar with palms facing each other
Keep elbows pinned and extend fully, squeezing triceps
Control the negative for 2 seconds each rep

exercises.name: Dumbbell Front Raises
exercises.notes: Superset with pushdowns - anterior delt development
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides, palms facing thighs
Raise one or both arms to shoulder height, no higher
Lower with control, maintain slight elbow bend

exercises.name: Skull Crushers
exercises.notes: Build tricep mass for improved lockout
instructions: Lie on bench with EZ bar extended over shoulders
Lower bar to forehead by bending only at elbows
Extend back to start, keeping upper arms vertical

workouts.name: Lower Body A - Heavy
workouts.focus: Maximal squat strength with posterior chain development

activities: Warm-up squat sets: 50% x 5, 70% x 3, 85% x 2
Hip flexor stretch 45 seconds each side

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
exercises.notes: Heavier than phase 1, focus on depth and power
instructions: Brace hard, big breath into belly before descending
Control descent, hit depth, then drive up explosively
Keep chest up throughout, dont let hips shoot back first

exercises.name: Pause Squat
exercises.notes: 2-second pause in the hole - builds starting strength
instructions: Descend to bottom and hold for 2 full seconds
Maintain tightness and position during pause
Explode out of hole without bouncing or shifting

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Heavier than phase 1, posterior chain strength
instructions: Start at top with bar at hips, maintain slight knee bend
Push hips back while keeping bar close to thighs
Stop when strong stretch is felt, squeeze glutes to return

exercises.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
exercises.notes: Glute strength for squat and deadlift power
instructions: Upper back on bench, bar in hip crease with pad
Drive through heels, squeeze glutes at top for 2 seconds
Lower with control, dont just drop the weight

exercises.name: Lying Leg Curl
exercises.notes: Hamstring isolation for knee health and leg development
instructions: Adjust pad position so it sits just above ankles
Curl with control, squeeze hamstrings at top
Lower slowly for 3 seconds, dont let weight crash

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Heavier weight than phase 1 for strength development
instructions: Position balls of feet on platform, full range of motion
Raise as high as possible, hold top for 2 seconds
Lower slowly to full stretch, no bouncing

workouts.name: Upper Body Pull A - Heavy
workouts.focus: Heavy rowing and pulling for back strength and pressing balance

exercises.name: Pendlay Row
exercises.notes: Explosive from floor each rep - builds pulling power
instructions: Bar starts on floor each rep, torso parallel to ground
Explosively row bar to lower chest
Lower back to floor with control, reset position each rep

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-Ups
exercises.notes: Add more weight than phase 1, lower reps
instructions: Dead hang start with weight attached
Pull explosively until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full arm extension

exercises.name: One Arm Dumbbell Row
exercises.notes: Heavy unilateral work for back thickness
instructions: Hand and knee on bench, opposite foot on floor
Pull dumbbell to hip, squeezing lat at top
Lower with control, full stretch at bottom

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise - constant tension rowing
instructions: Sit with knees slightly bent, maintain upright torso
Pull handle to lower chest, squeezing shoulder blades
Extend arms fully with control, dont let shoulders round

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Superset with rows - maintain shoulder health emphasis
instructions: Set cable at face height, pull rope to face
End with thumbs pointing behind you, externally rotate
Squeeze rear delts for 1 second, return with control

exercises.name: Barbell Curl
exercises.notes: Heavier than phase 1, strict form
instructions: Stand with feet hip width, elbows pinned to sides
Curl without swinging body, focus on bicep contraction
Lower with control for 2-3 seconds, full extension

exercises.name: Hammer Curls
exercises.notes: Brachialis and forearm development for arm size
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides with palms facing each other
Curl both or alternating, keeping palm orientation fixed
Lower with control, maintain tall posture throughout

workouts.name: Lower Body B - Heavy
workouts.focus: Deadlift strength with quad accessory work

activities: Light deadlifts building to working weight

exercises.name: Conventional Deadlift
exercises.notes: Heavy singles and doubles build true strength
instructions: Setup with bar over mid-foot, take slack out before pulling
Push floor away, chest up, bar stays close to body
Lock out with glute squeeze, dont hyperextend

exercises.name: Deficit Deadlift
exercises.notes: 2-3 inch deficit, builds strength off the floor
instructions: Stand on 2-3 inch platform or plates
Use same form as conventional but start lower
Pull to lockout, lower with control back to platform

exercises.name: Hack Squat Machine
exercises.notes: Quad emphasis without lower back fatigue
instructions: Position shoulders under pads, feet shoulder width
Lower until knees reach 90 degrees or just below
Press up through full foot, dont lock knees completely

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.notes: 10 reps each leg, heavier than phase 1
instructions: Hold heavy dumbbells at sides, take long strides
Lower back knee to just above floor
Drive through front heel to stand into next stride

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.notes: Pump work for quad development after compounds
instructions: Extend fully and squeeze quads for 2 seconds at top
Lower slowly with control, dont let weight crash
Focus on contraction quality over weight

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollout
exercises.notes: Core strength for improved stability in all lifts
instructions: Start kneeling with wheel under shoulders
Roll forward as far as you can control
Pull back using abs, dont let lower back sag

workouts.name: Upper Body Push B - Volume
workouts.focus: Higher volume pressing with emphasis on muscle retention and weak points

activities: 5 minutes arm circles and light movement

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Standard bench to practice competition style after paused work
instructions: Touch and go style but with control, no bouncing
Maintain same tight setup as pause bench
Focus on bar speed off chest

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Back off set for volume after heavy barbell work
instructions: Set up with dumbbells at shoulders, feet flat
Lower with control feeling pec stretch at bottom
Press up bringing dumbbells together at top

exercises.name: Standing Landmine Press
exercises.notes: Shoulder-friendly pressing alternative
instructions: Hold end of barbell at shoulder with one or both hands
Press up and forward in arc following the bar path
Lower with control, maintain tight core throughout

exercises.name: Cable Flye
exercises.notes: Superset with next exercise - chest pump work
instructions: Set cables at shoulder height, step forward for tension
Bring hands together in front of chest with slight elbow bend
Squeeze pecs hard at the peak contraction

exercises.name: Tricep Dips Machine
exercises.notes: Superset with flyes - higher rep tricep work
instructions: Adjust seat so handles are at armpit level
Press down and extend fully, squeezing triceps
Control the return, dont let weight stack crash

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
exercises.notes: Slightly heavier than phase 1 for progressive overload
instructions: Lead with elbows and pinkies slightly higher than thumbs
Raise to shoulder height, no higher
Control descent for 2 seconds, no swinging

exercises.name: Rope Overhead Extension
exercises.notes: Tricep long head emphasis to finish
instructions: Face away from cable, hold rope overhead
Lower rope behind head keeping upper arms fixed
Extend fully and spread rope apart at top

mealTiming: Breakfast: 40-50g protein within 1 hour of waking
Pre-workout: Carb-focused meal 2 hours before, lighter snack 30 min before
Intra-workout: Optional fast carbs if energy drops (gatorade, fruit)
Post-workout: Fast protein immediately, full meal within 1.5 hours
Pre-bed: Slow digesting protein for overnight recovery
nutrition.notes: Slightly increased calories to support heavier training demands. Protein bumped to support muscle repair from intense sessions. If feeling overly fatigued, add 100-200 more carbs on heavy training days. Week 8 reduce calories to maintenance for testing week.

progressionProtocol: Week 5: Establish new working weights 5-10% heavier than phase 1 maxes
Week 6: Focus on bar speed and power on main lifts, add weight only if fast
Week 7: Peak intensity week - heaviest weights of the program
Week 8: Deload week - reduce volume 40%, test bench press max end of week
